name: lz4

variants.name: libs
variants.description: Build shared libs, static libs or both

description:
LZ4 is lossless compression algorithm, providing compression speed at
400 MB/s per core, scalable with multi-cores CPU. It also features an
extremely fast decoder, with speed in multiple GB/s per core, typically
reaching RAM speed limits on multi-core systems.

dependencies.name: valgrind
dependencies.description:
An instrumentation framework for building dynamic analysis. There are
Valgrind tools that can automatically detect many memory management and
threading bugs, and profile your programs in detail. You can also use
Valgrind to build new tools. Valgrind is Open Source / Free Software,
and is freely available under the GNU General Public License, version 2.

dependent_to.description: Apache Subversion - an open source version control system.

dependent_to.name: adios
dependent_to.description:
The Adaptable IO System (ADIOS) provides a simple, flexible way for
scientists to describe the data in their code that may need to be
written, read, or processed outside of the running simulation.

dependent_to.name: zstd
dependent_to.description:
Zstandard, or zstd as short version, is a fast lossless compression
algorithm, targeting real-time compression scenarios at zlib-level and
better compression ratios.

dependent_to.name: paraview
dependent_to.description:
ParaView is an open-source, multi-platform data analysis and
visualization application.

dependent_to.name: c-blosc2
dependent_to.description:
Next generation c-blosc with a new API, a new container and other bells
and whistles

dependent_to.name: netdata
dependent_to.description: Real-time performance monitoring, done right!

dependent_to.name: flux-core
dependent_to.description: A next-generation resource manager (pre-alpha)

dependent_to.name: vtk
dependent_to.description:
The Visualization Toolkit (VTK) is an open-source, freely available
software system for 3D computer graphics, image processing and
visualization.

dependent_to.name: librdkafka
dependent_to.description: librdkafka is a C library implementation of the Apache Kafka protocol.

dependent_to.name: mariadb
dependent_to.description:
MariaDB Server is one of the most popular database servers in the world.
MariaDB turns data into structured information in a wide array of
applications, ranging from banking to websites. It is an enhanced, drop-
in replacement for MySQL. MariaDB is used because it is fast, scalable
and robust, with a rich ecosystem of storage engines, plugins and many
other tools make it very versatile for a wide variety of use cases.

dependent_to.name: c-blosc
dependent_to.description: Blosc, an extremely fast, multi-threaded, meta-compressor library

dependent_to.name: libarchive
dependent_to.description:
libarchive: C library and command-line tools for reading and writing
tar, cpio, zip, ISO, and other archive formats.

dependent_to.name: rsync
dependent_to.description: An open source utility that provides fast incremental file transfer.

dependent_to.name: eckit
dependent_to.description:
ecKit is a cross-platform c++ toolkit that supports development of tools
and applications at ECMWF.

dependent_to.name: jhpcn-df
dependent_to.description:
Data compression library based on Jointed Hierarchical Precision
Compression Number - Data Format JHPCN-DF is a novel lossy compression
algorithm taylored for floating point dataset. The algorithm enhances
the effect of employing standard compression algorithms like deflate
because this approach makes the occurence rate of the same byte pattern
in data stream higher owing to truncating some lower bits of
significand.

dependent_to.name: rocksdb
dependent_to.description: RocksDB: A Persistent Key-Value Store for Flash and RAM Storage

dependent_to.name: tkrzw
dependent_to.description:
Tkrzw is a C++ library implementing database managers with various
algorithms.

dependent_to.name: py-uproot
dependent_to.description:
ROOT I/O in pure Python and NumPy. Uproot is a reader and a writer of
the ROOT file format using only Python and Numpy. Unlike the standard
C++ ROOT implementation, Uproot is only an I/O library, primarily
intended to stream data into machine learning libraries in Python.
Unlike PyROOT and root_numpy, Uproot does not depend on C++ ROOT.
Instead, it uses Numpy to cast blocks of data from the ROOT file as
Numpy arrays.

dependent_to.name: orc
dependent_to.description: the smallest, fastest columnar storage for Hadoop workloads.

dependent_to.name: root
dependent_to.description: ROOT is a data analysis framework.

dependent_to.name: squashfuse
dependent_to.description: squashfuse - Mount SquashFS archives using FUSE

dependent_to.name: py-uproot4
dependent_to.description:
DEPRECATED! This package was renamed to py-uproot. ROOT I/O in pure
Python and NumPy.

dependent_to.name: slurm
dependent_to.description:
Slurm is an open source, fault-tolerant, and highly scalable cluster
management and job scheduling system for large and small Linux clusters.
Slurm requires no kernel modifications for its operation and is
relatively self-contained. As a cluster workload manager, Slurm has
three key functions. First, it allocates exclusive and/or non-exclusive
access to resources (compute nodes) to users for some duration of time
so they can perform work. Second, it provides a framework for starting,
executing, and monitoring work (normally a parallel job) on the set of
allocated nodes. Finally, it arbitrates contention for resources by
managing a queue of pending work.
